ReportSection.ReportItem:
CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT

This Confidentiality Agreement is given to the Canadian Frailty Network (CFN) in consideration of my role as a Grant Reviewer to review grant application(s) (Information) for CFN.

I acknowledge that as part of my role as a Grant Reviewer for CFN I may be given access to information that is of a personal, confidential and/ or proprietary nature, for example: names, e-mail addresses, financial information, funding applications and their status, trade secrets, research data, and any other information for the purpose of fulfilling my obligations.

I, therefore agree:

  • To hold all Information in trust and strict confidence and agree that it shall be used only for the purposes required to fulfill my role as a Grant Reviewer, and shall not be used for any other purpose, or disclosed to any third party.
  • To keep all Information in my control or possession in a secure location to which only I and other persons who are authorized to view this information, and have signed a confidentiality agreement with CFN, have access.
  • To take all necessary steps to keep all Information secure and to protect such Information from unauthorized use, reproduction or disclosure.
  • To maintain the absolute confidentiality of all Information in recognition of the privacy and proprietary rights of others at all times.
  • To comply with all privacy laws and regulations, which apply to the collection, use and disclosure of personal information.
  • At the conclusion of my role as a Grant Reviewer, or upon demand by CFN, to return all Information, including prototypes, code, written notes, photographs, sketches, models, memoranda or notes taken, to CFNâ€™s possession and the responsible manager/director.
  • Not to disclose any Information to any employee, consultant or third party unless they agree to execute and be bound by the terms of this agreement and have been approved by CFN in an official, legal capacity.

I understand that a breach of confidentiality or misuse of Information could result legal action.

I understand that this Agreement survives the termination of my relationship with CFN.

The laws of Ontario, Canada shall govern this Agreement and its validity, construction and effect.

I fully understand and accept responsibilities set above relating to personal, confidential and/or proprietary Information:

  • Personal Information is any information about an "identifiable individual".
  • Confidential Information is any information which is designated by CFN as confidential.
  • Proprietary Information is any information which is designated by CFN as proprietary like trade secrets, and research data.

ReportSection.name: External Review
ReportSection.Instructions:
1. Please complete both sections A and B.
  2. Goal of the Competition: The Catalyst Program supports novel/innovative pilot, feasibility, and/or translational studies. Proposals must demonstrate future scalability by providing a description of future plans to implement the study across Canada in a future grant submission. It is expected that successful Catalyst grants will be suitable for future larger scale CFN funding opportunities.
  3. Observational studies or studies that do not study the impact of interventions will not be funded.
  4. When reviewing/scoring grants please consider that the applicant's were informed that proposals will be judged on the following:
    • Proposals need to demonstrate the potential that results would be recognized nationally and globally for scientific excellence.
    • Proposals should have clearly defined research question(s) and knowledge or practice gap(s) for the care of frail elderly Canadians
    • Each proposal must include the evaluation of one or more: i) patient-centred outcomes, ii) patient/family satisfaction or iii) health economic outcomes
    • Proposals must have a well described methodology and must demonstrate that key deliverables and measurable outcomes are achievable within the funding period
    • Project team members will be adjudicated for their level of experience and expertise. Where appropriate, proposals must include a health economist and/or ethicist on the project team
    • Degree to which projects have high translational capacity towards improving care for frail elderly Canadians.
    • Budget: Maximum $100,00 over a maximum period of 1 year.

ReportSection.Instructions:
1. Please complete all sections.
  2. Goal of the Competition: The Catalyst Program supports novel/innovative pilot, feasibility, and/or translational studies. Proposals must demonstrate future scalability by providing a description of future plans to implement the study across Canada in a future grant submission. It is expected that successful Catalyst grants will be suitable for future larger scale CFN funding opportunities.
  3. When reviewing/scoring grants please consider that the applicant's were informed that proposals will be judged on the following:
    1. Investigator will need to map out how the current and future research plans will help accelerate improvement in care for frail elderly Canadians and their caregivers, and provide a socio-economic benefit for Canada. Observational studies or studies that do not study the impact of interventions will not be funded.
    2. Research projects must fit within CFNâ€™s strategic priorities (i.e., Matching care to values; Empowering, engaging and supporting patients and their families and caregivers; Improving clinical outcomes; Improving care across the continuum)
    3. Research projects must fit within CFNâ€™s patient-oriented research themes (i.e., Improving end-of-life care (EOL)/advance care planning (ACP); Improving acute care/critical care; Optimizing community care/residential care; Optimizing transitions of care)
    4. Proposals must demonstrate significant partnerships which will increase translation of project results into policy and/or practice. Potential for commercialization of research results is an asset although not required. Proposals must have demonstrated committed cash or eligible in-kind contributions from NCE-eligible partners totaling a minimum of 50% of CFNâ€™s funding. To be clear, if $100,000 is requested from CFN the applicants must secure an additional minimum $50,000 in partner contributions.
    5. Networking: In general CFN seeks projects that represent the collaborative efforts of investigators in more than one discipline and at more than one institution, from more than one province, and with the involvement of partners and stakeholders from multiple sectors. Note: For these smaller Catalyst grants investigators were advised that minimally the proposal needed to describe future plans to address these networking requirements.
    6. Research teams must include patients and families, knowledge users, and HQP as meaningfully involved and integral team members.
